org.dblp.mmdb

Class RecordDb

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dblp.mmdb.RecordDb
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordDbInterface, RecordDbLocalInterface

    public class RecordDb
extends java.lang.Object
implements RecordDbInterface
    An in-memory data structure for dblp's publication and person record corpus. It parses the dblp.xml, a concatenated version of all dblp records in the /dblp/publ tree.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

    • Constructor Detail

      • RecordDb

        public RecordDb(java.io.InputStream xmlInputStream,
                java.io.InputStream dtdInputStream,
                boolean verbose)
         throws java.io.IOException,
                org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Constructs the record DB for the given dblp records from the input stream.
        Parameters:
        xmlInputStream - The dblp XML records to be loaded into the main memory database.
        dtdInputStream - The content of the dblp.dtd. If set to null, the dblp.dtd file needs to be available in the classpath.
        verbose - If true, progress and timing information is logged to stderr.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any IO errors occur while parsing the XML stream.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if any SAX errors occur while parsing the XML stream.

        Constructs the main memory database for the given dblp file.

        Throws:

        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if a given file cannot be opened for reading.

      • fromGzip

        public static RecordDb fromGzip(java.io.InputStream gzipInputStream,
                                java.io.InputStream dtdInputStream,
                                boolean verbose)
                         throws java.util.zip.ZipException,
                                java.io.IOException,
                                org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Static factory method to constructs the main memory database for a gzipped dblp XML input.
        Parameters:
        gzipInputStream - The gzipped dblp XML file to be loaded into the main memory database.
        dtdInputStream - The dblp.dtd file.
        verbose - If true, progress and timing information is logged to stderr.
        Returns:
        The record DB.
        Throws:
        java.util.zip.ZipException - if a GZIP format error occurs or the compression method used is unsupported.
        java.io.IOException - if any IO errors occur while parsing the XML.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - if any SAX errors occur while parsing the XML.

      • ensureCoauthorGraph

        public void ensureCoauthorGraph()
        Description copied from interface: RecordDbInterface
        Trigger that the lazy coauthor graph data structure is build, if it has not been build yet.

        Waring: Forcing the coauthor graph to build completely is kind of inefficient and requires a lot of main memory.

        Specified by:
        ensureCoauthorGraph in interface RecordDbInterface

      • getAllHomonymsByName

        public java.util.Collection<PersonName> getAllHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
                                                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Description copied from interface: RecordDbInterface
        Retrieve an unmodifiable collection of all person name objects that are homonyms of the given name string, including person name objects of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Specified by:
        getAllHomonymsByName in interface RecordDbInterface
        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The homonymous persons, or an empty set if the given name is not in dblp.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • allHomonymsByName

        public java.util.stream.Stream<PersonName> allHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
                                                      throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Description copied from interface: RecordDbInterface
        Retrieves a sequential stream of all person name objects that are homonyms of the given name string, including person name objects of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Specified by:
        allHomonymsByName in interface RecordDbInterface
        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The stream of homonymous persons, or an empty stream if the given name is not in dblp.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified name is null.

      • numberOfAllHomonymsByName

        public int numberOfAllHomonymsByName(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: RecordDbInterface
        Retrieve the number of homonyms of the given name in dblp, including person name objects of that given name string if it exists in dblp. Retrieval of homonyms is sensitive to case, diacritics, and abbreviations.

        If a person of the exact given name does not exist in dblp, this method may still find homonyms that exist in dblp (e.g., "Wei Wang 9999" does not exist, but has homonyms "Wei Wang", "Wei Wang 0001", and so on).

        Specified by:
        numberOfAllHomonymsByName in interface RecordDbInterface
        Parameters:
        name - The name string.
        Returns:
        The number of homonyms, or 0 if the given name is not in dblp.

      • numberOfCoauthorCommunities

        public int numberOfCoauthorCommunities(Person person,
                                       boolean allowDisambiguations)
                                throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Description copied from interface: RecordDbInterface
        Return the number of coauthor communities of the given person.
        Specified by:
        numberOfCoauthorCommunities in interface RecordDbInterface
        Parameters:
        person - The person.
        allowDisambiguations - If true, disambiguation profiles are valid coauthor nodes that link the network. Otherwise, disambiguation profiles are considered to have no coauthors and end up as singleton cluster nodes in the network.
        Returns:
        The number of communities.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified person is null.

      • getCoauthorCommunity

        public java.util.Collection<Person> getCoauthorCommunity(Person person,
                                                         int index,
                                                         boolean allowDisambiguations)
                                                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                                         java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Description copied from interface: RecordDbInterface
        Retrieve a specific coauthor community of a given person.
        Specified by:
        getCoauthorCommunity in interface RecordDbInterface
        Parameters:
        person - The person.
        index - The community index, starting with 0.
        allowDisambiguations - If true, disambiguation profiles are valid coauthor nodes that link the network. Otherwise, disambiguation profiles are considered to have no coauthors and end up as singleton cluster nodes in the network.
        Returns:
        The coauthors of this community.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the specified person is null.
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range (index < 0 || index >= getNumberOfCommunities())

                            Person second)
                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException

        Parameters:
        first - The first person.
        second - The second person.
        Returns:
        true if both persons are coauthors, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either of the given persons is null.

      • getShortestCoauthorPath

        public java.util.List<Person> getShortestCoauthorPath(Person first,
                                                      Person second,
                                                      boolean allowDisambiguations)
        Description copied from interface: RecordDbInterface
        Retrieves a list of person that form path of coauthors between the two given authors using a minimal number of edges. If no such path exists, an empty list is returned.

        Note: This is a very expensive operation, so handle with care!

        Specified by:
        getShortestCoauthorPath in interface RecordDbInterface
        Parameters:
        first - The first person.
        second - The second person.
        allowDisambiguations - If true, disambiguation profiles are valid coauthor nodes that link the network. Otherwise, disambiguation profiles are considered to have no outgoing coauthors.
        Returns:
        The path as list of persons, or an empty list if no such path exists.
